author: GeneralOlde

text: I know that; I was referring more to her character model. Her portrait is... mostly true to her design, aside from some odd color choices (overly dark skin and teal robes), but her character model in the overworld and battle sequences looks really off. They gave her grey hair for some reason.
author: GeneralOlde

text:
I believe it was due to the fact the Sega CD had a strange / limited color pallet.

The entire game has a rather dark color-scheme. They seemed to fix most of the issues with Lunar 2: Eternal Blue, that is, until you look at the Menu and it's very puke-green color.

text: Lunar: Silver Star Story Complete came with 4 discs (2 game 1 OST and 1 making of, track list wasn't given at time of release) and a cheese cloth map and a hardcover manual (which I think hasn't been done before or since after Lunar 2) Lunar: Eternal Blue Complete came with: 4 discs (2 game, 1 OST, 1 making of), an Omake box that had lucia's pendant and some character token thingies and a hardcover manual. author: jackal27

text:
I'd have to say that by playing all the versions of Lunar: Silver Star for many years, I'd have to say that the Sega CD version was the best of them all. It had more memorable music and events.

The PSX changes were a bit nice but in the end didn't sit too well with me. Maybe it's because I played the Sega version first. The only thing I liked more in the PSX version was the Lyrical Music, which was quite impressive.

Now, Lunar 2 is quite a different story and one I wish not to get into.

text: If you head to a flea market or even a gamestop, you should be able to pick up a Ps1 for very cheap. and im curious as to why ive been downgraded so much on my previous comment. the GBA port altered the story, ommited the animated cutscenes, the intro movie, the spoken dialogue, about 50% of the original story/gameplay....it was a decent attempt with the available hardware of the GBA, but in comparison it just doesnt hold a candle.
